title.narrative: Agriculture and Rural Development Project - Additional Financing

description.narrative: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) approved on 29 September 2008 a grant of $14.72 million from its Asian Development Fund (ADF) for the Agriculture and Rural Development Project (original project). The closing date of the original project grant is 31 December 2013. The original project is supported by associated technical assistance of $2 million from the Japan Special Fund for agricultural marketing and brand development. The original project aims at a reliable supply of premium-value agricultural products to niche markets by selected enterprises, which induces agricultural and rural economic growth. The original project comprises two outputs: (i) value chains able to deliver unique, premium-value products to niche markets, and rural infrastructure and services development; and (ii) fully defined process and institutional arrangements for collaborative brand development and management developed and demonstrated.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Finance (formerly Ministry of Finance and Economy)
Ministry of Food, Agriculture, and Light Industry (MOFALI)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Value addition to agricultural resources enhanced by PPEs

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

By Q4 2020, compared with the level before VCI implementation: a. PPEs increase their shares of processed products in total sales by at least 10% (added) b. Export-oriented PPEs increase their export share in total sales by 20% on average (added) c. PPEs generate 1,800 new jobs, of which at least 40% are to be filled by women (added; 2015 baseline: 1,150)

description.narrative: Value addition to agricultural resources enhanced by PPEs
